description: Angola's 2018-2030 national strategies for adapting to climate change with low carbon development and poverty reduction. Particular emphasis is placed on addressing challenges of floods, droughts, soil erosion and rising sea levels.

description: Adaptation and mitigation strategies for the period of 2020-2025 concerning agriculture, forestry, livestock and fisheries sectors

description:
A framework for building the country's adaptive capacity and resilience, and facilitate the integration of climate change adaptation into relevant policies,
programmes and activities for specific key sectors, including agriculture.

description: One of several CCAFS-led projects to promote food security under a changing climate. This project concerns the establishment of a climate-smart village in Tougou in the Yatenga region. In Tougou, farmers, researchers and local partners test portfolios of climate-smart technologies and practices.
link_text: Developing Climate-Smart Village Models in Burkina Faso

description: Burkina Faso is a member of the Climate-Smart Agriculture Alliance launched in June 2015, in Mali, in partnership with ECOWAS and CCAFS. This alliance aims to enhance adaptation and resilience to climate variability and change, while increasing farm productivity and incomes sustainably and equitably, and controlling and reducing greenhouse gas emissions wherever possible and appropriate, at a regional level.

description: Join World Bank-Government of Burundi project with the objective of restoring land productivity in targeted degraded landscapes
link_text: Burundi Landscape Restoration and Resilience Project (2018-2024)

description: Ministry of Livestock, Fisheries, and Animal Industries-implemented project contributing to climate smart agriculture livestock outcomes while improving productivity of systems and marketing of products.

description: A project supporting Cameroon's methane mitigation ambitions in the next NDC update in the livestock and rice sub-sectors with improved emission and emission reduction data.

description: National report identifying priorities to address climate risks with a climate resilient agriculture, forestry and land Use system being one of the primary priority sectors.

description: A 6-year project aiming to increase climate-resilient agriculture, capacity building, policy engagement, knowledge management, climate-resilient rural transportation and water infrastructures.

description: A project with the objective of ensuring ecosystem protection, services and food security through enhanced agro-sylvo-pastoralism and sustainable natural resources management

description: Innovative national project with the objective of increasing productivity and strengthening climate resiliency of agricultural production systems by promoting the adoption of improved technologies and climate-smart agriculture.

description: A strategic document presenting national adaptation priorities alongside sustainable development needs.

description: A project aiming to strengthen resiliency of vulnerable communities by building adaptive capacity to recurrent drought risks and promoting the sustainable management of oases and associated ecosystems.
link_text: Reversing the degradation trend in the oases of Borkou, Ennedi West and Wadi Fira through strengthening adaptation measures and improving resilience to climate change of vulnerable communities

description: A project targeting individuals dependent on agricultural livelihoods with the aim of reducing vulnerability to the impacts of climate change and strengthening adaptive capacities of vulnerable communities and the ecosystems they depend on, by promoting food security, nutrition and use a gender sensitive approach.
link_text: Building adaptive capacity to climate change in vulnerable communities living in the Congo River Basin

description: A summit in August 2023 of convening 230 actors from across the Congo Basin representing governments, civil society organisations, indigenous and local populations, women’s organisations, young people, the media, religious institutions, cultural institutions, research institutions, pastoralists, fishermen, small-scale farmers and entrepreneurs. The summit was organized in recognition of the potential of agroecology as a fundamental solution for establishing resilient food system, the undeniable role of indigenous peoples and local communities in the conservation and preservation. The gathering identified main challenges, urgent needs, priorities and calls to action.
link_text: Kinshasa Declaration on reconciling food production with biodiversity conservation and climate emergency in the Congo Basin

description: A review paper providing comprehensive evidence of CSA-associated farming practices in DRC, public and private efforts to promote CSA practices, and the associated benefits accruing from the practices as deployed by farmers in the DRC.
link_text: Current Practices and Prospects of Climate-Smart Agriculture in Democratic Republic of Congo: A Review

description: National project with the main objective of strengthening the resilience of smallholder farmers to the effects of climate change through the adoption of proven innovative technologies and practices.

description: A project with the aim of improving the climate resilience of vulnerable ecosystems and increasing the adaptive capacity of rural poor to respond to the impacts of climate change in Djibouti.

description: A Ministry of Environment and United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)-led initiative to develop community resilience to projected worsening of drought conditions by developing and maintaining date palm shade gardens, serving as the foundation for a diversified, climate-resilient agricultural and pastoral economy.
link_text: Developing Agro-Pastoral Shade Gardens as an Adaptation Strategy for Poor Rural Communities

description: A project with the aim of increasing the resilience of smallholder farmers and pastoralists to climate change risks mainly those related to drought, through the establishment of appropriate early warning systems and implementation of drought adaptation actions in the IGAD region.

description: A summit in August 2023 of convening 230 actors from across the Congo Basin representing governments, civil society organisations, indigenous and local populations, women’s organisations, young people, the media, religious institutions, cultural institutions, research institutions, pastoralists, fishermen, small-scale farmers and entrepreneurs. The summit was organized in recognition of the potential of agroecology as a fundamental solution for establishing resilient food system, the undeniable role of indigenous peoples and local communities in the conservation and preservation. description: A joint Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Forests and Environment-FAO project to conserve and enhance forest carbon stocks and promote sustainable livelihoods through community-based sustainable forest and land management.
link_text: Promoting Community-Based Forestry for Climate Change Mitigation and Sustainable Livelihoods in Equatorial Guinea

description: In line with national priorities, this project will strengthen institutional and technical capacities in the Agriculture, Forestry and other Land Use (AFOLU) sector to respond to the enhanced transparency requirements of the Paris Agreement
link_text: Enhancing Equatorial Guinea’s institutional and technical capacity in the agriculture, forestry and other land-use sector for enhanced transparency under the Paris Agreement

description: A programme with the overall goal of promoting increased food security in Eritrea through ecologically sustainable and climate-resilient improvements in agricultural production. The programme's main objective is to increase community resilience and adaptive capacity to climate change through an integrated water management and agricultural development approach
link_text: Climate Change Adaptation Programme In Water and Agriculture In Anseba Region, Eritrea

description: A project with the objective of promoting inclusive, sustainable and climate-relevant transformation of the Eritrean dairy value chain to enhance food and nutrition security, reduce poverty, create job opportunities for young people, and promote resilience to climate change while mitigating greenhouse gas emissions.
link_text: Climate Smart Agriculture Research and Innovation Support for Dairy Value Chains in Eritrea

description: This project aims to promote greater food security through ecologically sustainable and climate-resilient improvements in agricultural production. The objective of the programme is to increase community resilience and adaptive capacity to climate change through an integrated water management and agricultural development approach in the sub-regions of Hamelmalo and Habero. Stakeholders include community, civil society and government representatives.
link_text: Water and Agriculture Adaptation in Anseba Region, Eritrea

description: This programme is located across Eswatini, Namibia, Lesotho and South Africa. It is the first private sector climate finance facility in Africa using a pioneering green bank model. It will de-risk and increase the bankability of climate projects in order to crowd in private sector investment. Its successful implementation will replicate similar financial models in other countries.
link_text: Development Bank of Southern Africa (DBSA) Climte Finance Facility

description: In collaboration with the Food, Agriculture and Natural Resources Policy Analysis Network (FANRPAN), this programme aims to strengthen agricultural practices which sustainably increase productivity and lead to a climate resilient system while simultaneously removing greenhouse gases.
link_text: Climate Smart Agriculture pilot program

description: An EU-funded project working to improve smallholder production and marketing systems that lead to sustainable food security and improvement for rural households. Climate-change related activities include conservation agriculture, strengthening agricultural extension systems and crop diversification/market linkages.
link_text: Swaziland Agricultural Development Programme (SADP)

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance in Ethiopia

description: A project with the overall objective of increasing resilience to recurrent droughts in seven agro-ecological landscapes in Ethiopia through an integrated water, agriculture and natural resource management approach.
link_text: Climate Smart Integrated Rural Development Project

description: An initiative with the goal of developing and implementing adaptation strategies and measures that will strengthen the resilience of vulnerable smallholder farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralists in the Horn of Africa to climate variability and change.
link_text: Agricultural Climate Resilience Enhancement Initiative (ACREI)

description: A summit in August 2023 of convening 230 actors from across the Congo Basin representing governments, civil society organisations, indigenous and local populations, women’s organisations, young people, the media, religious institutions, cultural institutions, research institutions, pastoralists, fishermen, small-scale farmers and entrepreneurs. The summit was organized in recognition of the potential of agroecology as a fundamental solution for establishing resilient food system, the undeniable role of indigenous peoples and local communities in the conservation and preservation. description: This project aims to decrease the pressure to clear forests for agricultural purposes. The fund will work to reduce emissions and increase the resilience of local communities by financing the transformation of tropical agricultural commodity supply chains from extractive to sustainable practices. The project will achieve this by providing technical assistance and financial support to producers with conditions that necessitate the protection and restoration of existing forests by focusing on supply chains in sectors that drive deforestation such as livestock, palm oil, soy, rubber, cocoa, and forestry.
link_text: &Green Fund: Investing in Inclusive Agriculture and Protecting Forests

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.
link_text: Scaling-up climate-resilient rice production in West Africa

description: A project with the overall goal of enhancing adaptive capacity of rural populations in The Gambia through support to climate-resilient and diversified livelihoods.
link_text: Rural Integrated Climate Adaptation and Resilience Building Project (RICAR)

description: The overarching objective is to build climate resilience by restoring and rehabilitating at least 10,000 hectares of forests, protected areas, wildlife areas and farmland, all of which are affected by rising temperatures, erratic rainfall and deforestation.
link_text: Large-scale ecosystem-based adaptation in the Gambia: Developing a climate-resilient, natural resource-based economy

description: One of several CCAFS-led projects to promote food security under a changing climate. This project concerns the establishment of a climate-smart village in Lawra, in the Lawra Jirapa region, where farmers work with researchers and other local partners to test a portfolio of climate-smart technologies and practices. Projects are implemented in an integrated manner in order to realize the triple benefits of climate-smart agriculture: productivity, adaptation and mitigation.

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.

description: A Guinean government led project, with support from the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), to increase the climate resilience and adaptive capacity of the most vulnerable communities through the introduction of climate-smart agricultural practices, enhanced access to microcredit, and improved utilisation of climate information.
link_text: Strengthening the climate resilience of communities in forested regions

description: This programme improves the resilience of populations and ecosystems in the Niger Basin by managing natural resources sustainably, reducing silting and enhancing the population's ability to adapt to climate change. It also includes some mitigation activities, including through forestry and land use.
link_text: Programme for integrated development and adaptation to climate change in the Niger Basin

description: Regional programme to build climate-resilient agricultural systems in small West and Central Africa nations by securing water resources for agricultural and domestic usages and  rehabilitating degraded lands to increase the climate resilience of agrarian ecosystems and enhance agricultural productivity.
link_text: West and Central Africa Small Island Developing States ADAPT – Building resilience of agricultural systems to climate change

description: A project to address key vulnerabilities in agriculture and water resources management, and thus contribute to immediate and longer-term development and resilience needs of extremely vulnerable farmers, with a particular focus on extremely vulnerable groups: women, elderly and children.
link_text: Scaling up climate-smart agriculture in East Guinea Bissau

description: This project aims to enhance the climate resilience of livelihoods and food security of the most vulnerable people in Northwest and Northcentral coastal regions of Guinea-Bissau by improving local observation and monitoring systems for water and soil quality, rehabilitating small-scale water management schemes such as rainwater retention systems and irrigations, undertaking functional reforestation of mangroves on 250 hectares of mangrove swamp areas, and strengthening agricultural value chains with microenterprises.
link_text: Adaptation of agricultural production systems in Coastal Areas of Northwest Guinea-Bissau

description: An initiative with the goal of developing and implementing adaptation strategies and measures that will strengthen the resilience of vulnerable smallholder farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralists in the Horn of Africa to climate variability and change.

description: A project with the aim of increasing the resilience of smallholder farmers and pastoralists to climate change risks mainly those related to drought, through the establishment of appropriate early warning systems and implementation of drought adaptation actions in the IGAD region.

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance in Kenya

description: A project with the main goal of enhancing the adaptive capacity and build the resilience of vulnerable and food insecure households and communities to the impacts of climate change on food security.
link_text: Improving adaptive capacity of vulnerable and food-insecure populations in Lesotho

description: This programme is located across Eswatini, Namibia, Lesotho and South Africa. It is the first private sector climate finance facility in Africa using a pioneering green bank model. It will de-risk and increase the bankability of climate projects in order to crowd in private sector investment. Its successful implementation will replicate similar financial models in other countries.
link_text: Development Bank of Southern Africa (DBSA) Climate Finance Facility

description: A multisectoral national policy, guiding key sectors like water, agriculture, energy, and transport in adaptation and mitigation efforts to foster a climate-resilient, low-carbon national development.
link_text: The Lesotho National Climate Change Policy (2017 - 2027)

description: A project with the objective of reducing the effects of climate change on agricultural activities and farmers in the cocoa and rice cultivation sectors.
link_text: Building Climate Resilience in Liberia’s Cocoa and Rice Sectors

description: This project aims to increase the resilience of Liberia’s population and infrastructure to climate change through (i) improved hydrometeorological service generation and provision, in line with WMO requirements for establishing a functioning National Meteorological and Hydrological Service, (ii) improved risk knowledge and awareness of both Government institutions and communities, and (iii) mechanisms to better prepare and respond to climate hazards through an enabling environment, appropriate legislation, agency coordination as well as implementing an effective impact-based forecasting and forecast-based financing mechanism.
link_text: Enhancing Climate Information Systems for Resilient Development in Liberia

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.
link_text: Scaling-up climate-resilient rice production in West Africa

description: A United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)-led project aiming to help those in the rice sector increase climate resiliency through increased rice production that will withstand projected climate conditions and increased environmental sustainability and ecological services.
link_text: Promoting climate resilience in the rice sector through pilot investments in Alaotra-Mangoro region

description: This programme targets the most vulnerable populations of coastal and rural areas in four Indian Ocean SIDS where livelihoods are highly dependent on the region's rich ecosystems and natural resources - whether dominated by agriculture and fishing (as in Comoros and Madagascar) or tourism and the services sector (as in Mauritius and Seychelles). It will develop and implement ecosystem-based adaptation (EbA) activities. It will increase the resilience of both people and ecosystems in these four countries by enabling civil society organisations to support the conservation of critical ecosystems within biodiversity hotspots.
link_text: Ecosystem-based Adaptation in the Indian Ocean

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance

description: A project with the overall objective of building capacity to adapt to climate change through farmers associations, cooperatives, enhanced market access, and other sustainable and viable mechanisms for vulnerable and food insecure households to access different strategies and tools under an integrated climate risk management approach and access to market-based opportunities.
link_text: Adapting to Climate Change Through Integrated Risk Management Strategies and Enhanced Market Opportunities for Resilient Food Security and Livelihoods

description: The project will expand the meteorological network, instal automatic weather stations, hydrological monitoring stations, and lake-based weather buoys, as well as increase the capacity to identify risks and forecast impacts. Resulting information will be better disseminated through mobile, ICT, and radio channels targeting vulnerable farming communities, as well as fishing communities around Lake Malawi. Flood modelling for river systems will be improved, increasing warning times from 6 hours and under to 24- 48 hours. The private sector, including telecoms and micro and small enterprises will be engaged.
link_text: Scaling up the use of Modernized Climate information and Early Warning Systems in Malawi

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance

description: A network of national stakeholders, including scientists and policy makers, regularly exchanging knowledge on adaptation to climate change.
link_text: National Platform of Science-Policy Dialogue on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CASA C-Platform)

description: One of several CCAFS-led projects to promote food security under a changing climate. This project concerns the establishment of a climate-smart village in Cinzana in the Ségou region, where farmers work with researchers and other local partners to test a portfolio of climate-smart technologies and practices. Projects are implemented in an integrated manner in order to realize the triple benefits of climate-smart agriculture: productivity, adaptation and mitigation.
link_text: Developing Climate-Smart Village Models in Mali

description: Mali is a member of the Climate-Smart Agriculture Alliance launched in June 2015, in partnership with ECOWAS and CCAFS. This alliance aims to enhance adaptation and resilience to climate variability and change, while increasing farm productivity and incomes sustainably and equitably, and controlling and reducing greenhouse gas emissions wherever possible and appropriate, at a regional level.
link_text: West African Alliance for Climate-Smart Agriculture

description: A project to improve food security adaptation by assisting the government in improving technical services at the community level to increase village residents' resilience, informed decision-making ability, and adaption plans for livestock, land and water management and the overall use of natural resources.
link_text: Enhancing Resilience of Communities to the Adverse Effects of Climate Change on Food Security in Mauritania

description: A regional programme strengthening and scaling up the resilience and adaptive capacities of smallholder farmers and rural communities of seven least developed countries (LDCs) in the Sahel. It will provide capacity building and institutional development on integrated climate risks management. This includes reducing obstacles to access agricultural insurance for governments and smallholder farmers to enhance resilience building, and strengthening climate weather information services.
link_text: The Africa Integrated Climate Risk Management Programme: Building the resilience of smallholder farmers to climate change impacts in 7 Sahelian Countries of the Great Green Wall (GGW)

description: A cross-cutting programme (adaptation + mitigation) which enhances access to credit and technical assistance for local farmers, farmers’ organisations, cooperatives and micro and small sized enterprises. This will help them implement climate-resilient and low-emission agriculture and agroforestry. This programme covers 11 countries in the Great Green Wall, in addition to Côte d’Ivoire and Ghana. A major aim of the initiative is to build greater coherence and complementarity of climate action in Africa.
link_text: Inclusive Green Financing Initiative (IGREENFIN I): Greening Agricultural Banks & the Financial Sector to Foster Climate Resilient, Low Emission Smallholder Agriculture in the Great Green Wall (GGW) countries - Phase I

description: Focusing on semi-arid areas, this project will adopt a community-based approach to enhance the climate-resilient food security and livelihoods of smallholders. It will enhance adaptation for climate risks in households and communities through a rural resilience approach.
link_text: Climate-resilient food security for women and men smallholders in Mozambique through integrated risk management

description: This programme works to reduce or avoid climate change impacts through ecosystem-based adaptation for vulnerable coastal populations by pooling adaptation sub-projects by non-governmental organisation (NGOs) under the Blue Action Fund to improve climate-resilient coastal zone management. The programme will leverage additional co-financing from NGOs, while grant recipients are required to provide 25 percent of the budget of their projects.
link_text: Blue Action Fund (BAF): GCF Ecosystem Based Adaptation Programme in the Western Indian Ocean

description: This project aims to reduce the vulnerability of urban and peri-urban communities in the Greater Maputo Region (home to 3 million people) to current and future climate risks by addressing the degradation of ecosystems - and their services - and enhancing the capacity of communities to adapt. The project will do so by strengthening the capacity of municipal and district authorities to plan and implement ecosystem-based adaptation, restore mangrove and riparian ecosystems, promote climate-resilient livelihood, diversify economic activities, and increase the available knowledge and public awareness on the benefits of ecosystem-based adaptation interventions.
link_text: Building Resilience in the Coastal Zone through Ecosystem-Based Approaches to Adaptation in the Greater Maputo Area

description: The overall objective of the project is to enhance adaptation capacity and resilience of communities to changing weather patterns, drops/rises in water levels, and increased frequency of extreme weather events, such as droughts and floods.
link_text: Resilience building as climate change adaptation in drought-struck South-western African communities

description: This project uses Ecosystem-based Adaptation (EbA) as cost effective and low risk approach to build climate resilience across eight targeted landscapes in Namibia. The project is based on the premise that biodiversity and ecosystems provide valuable services that increase the climate resilience of local communities.
link_text: Building resilience of communities living in landscapes threatened under climate change through an ecosystems-based adaptation approach

description: This project addresses the impacts of increasing temperature and higher water evaporation on crop production and bush encroachment on land and livestock productivity to reduce vulnerability of smallholder farmers. It increases the efficiency with which rainfall is used to maintain agricultural and rangeland production.
link_text: Improving rangeland and ecosystem management practices of smallholder farmers under conditions of climate change in Sesfontein, Fransfontein, and Warmquelle areas of the Republic of Namibia

description: One of several CCAFS-led projects to promote food security under a changing climate. This project concerns the establishment of a climate-smart village in Fakara, in the Kollo region, where farmers work with researchers and other local partners to test a portfolio of climate-smart technologies and practices. Projects are implemented in an integrated manner in order to realize the triple benefits of climate-smart agriculture: productivity, adaptation and mitigation
link_text: Developing Climate-Smart Village Models in Niger

description: Niger is a member of the Climate-Smart Agriculture Alliance launched in June 2015, in Mali, in partnership with ECOWAS and CCAFS. This alliance aims to enhance adaptation and resilience to climate variability and change, while increasing farm productivity and incomes sustainably and equitably, and controlling and reducing greenhouse gas emissions wherever possible and appropriate, at a regional level.
link_text: West African Alliance for Climate-Smart Agriculture

description: A CCAFS initiative of building a network of national stakeholders, including scientists and policy makers, regularly exchanging knowledge on adaptation to climate change.
link_text: National science-policy dialogue platform

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.
link_text: Scaling-up climate-resilient rice production in West Africa

description: The Climate Change bill was signed into law by the President Buhari in November 2021 in order to provide Nigeria with a legal framework for the country to achieve its climate goals, achieve long-term social and economic sustainability, and resilience.. Key points include a Climate Change Fund, risk assessments, and mainstreaming adaptation into sectoral policies.
link_text: Nigeria's Climate Change Act

description: The Acumen Resilient Agriculture Fund (ARAF) is a regional fund to improve climate resilience to ensure long-term sustainable increases in agriculture productivity and incomes for smallholder farmers. It shifts the pattern of investment in climate change adaptation activities in Africa from grants to a long-term capital approach, enabling smallholder farmers to respond to climate change more efficiently and effectively. It supports innovative private social entrepreneurs in micro-, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) by providing aggregator and digital platform and innovative financial services to smallholder farmers.
link_text: Acumen Resilient Agriculture Fund (ARAF)

description: The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.
link_text: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin

description: The objective of the project is to increase the adaptive capacity of natural systems and rural communities to climate change impacts, notably recurring floods, landslides and erosion through an integrated natural resource management and alternative livelihoods programme.
link_text: Reducing Vulnerability to Climate Change in North West Rwanda through Community Based Adaptation

description: A programme to consolidate the sustainable agricultural transformation in Rwanda, by (i) fostering Rwanda’s agricultural transition to socially and environmentally inclusive food systems and (ii) ensuring Rwanda’s environmental and climate sustainability. The project will contribute to Rwanda’s Nationally Determined Contributions objective on climate adaptation.
link_text: Transformational climate-smart and inclusive agriculture in Rwanda

description: One of several CCAFS-led projects to promote food security under a changing climate. This project concerns the establishment of a climate-smart village in Daga Birame in Kaffrine region, where farmers work with researchers and other local partners to test a portfolio of climate-smart technologies and practices. Projects are implemented in an integrated manner in order to realize the triple benefits of climate-smart agriculture: productivity, adaptation and mitigation.
link_text: Developing Climate-Smart Village Models in Senegal

description: An initiative of building a network of national stakeholders, including scientists and policy makers, regularly exchanging knowledge on adaptation to climate change.
link_text: National science-policy dialogue platform

description: Senegal is a member of the Climate-Smart Agriculture Alliance launched in June 2015, in Mali, in partnership with ECOWAS and CCAFS. This alliance aims to enhance adaptation and resilience to climate variability and change, while increasing farm productivity and incomes sustainably and equitably, and controlling and reducing greenhouse gas emissions wherever possible and appropriate, at a regional level.
link_text: West African Alliance for Climate-Smart Agriculture

description: The overall objective of this additional climate finance for adaptation is to reduce vulnerability and increase adaptive capacity to respond to the impacts of climate change, including variability at local and national levels as well as on natural resources critical for sustaining agricultural production and increasing food security and nutrition of vulnerable poor communities.
link_text: Promoting Climate Resilience in the Cocoa and Rice Sectors as an Adaptation Strategy in Sierra Leone

description: This project enhances Sierra Leone’s resilience to natural disasters by establishing an efficient Multi-Hazard Impact-based Forecasting and Early Warning and Early Action System, to train and better equip local climate agencies’ ability to predict and plan for future extreme weather events based on robust climate information. An evidence-based approach will enable decision-makers to adapt better and more efficiently to changing climate patterns and rising sea levels.
link_text: Enhancing Climate Information Systems for Resilient Development in Sierra Leone

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.
link_text: Scaling-up climate-resilient rice production in West Africa

description: The Somalia’s National Adaptation Plan (NAP) Framework (NAP Framework) (2022) outlines the country's strategy, priorities, and actions for adapting to climate change.
link_text: Somalia’s National Adaptation Plan (NAP) Framework

description: A report outlining ways that policymakers in Somalia can increase access to climate finance and better integrate adaptation, mitigation and disaster risk management in socioeconomic development.
link_text: Climate-resilient development for Somalia

description: The objective of the project was to enhance resilience and improve adaptive capacity of vulnerable Somali communities and the ecosystems on which they depend to the adverse impacts of climate change. The activities of the project are seen as innovative and have practically enhanced the capacities of government institutions and communities to implement measures of adaptation to climate change, particularly to floods and droughts.
link_text: Enhancing Climate Resilience of the Vulnerable Communities and Ecosystems in Somalia

description: This project aims to reduce climate vulnerability and increase the resilience and adaptive capacity in rural and peri-urban settlements and small-scale farmers in productive landscapes in the uMgungundlovu District Municipality (UMDM), KwaZulu Natal Province, South Africa, that are threatened by climate variability and change, through an integrated adaptation approach.
link_text: Building Resilience in the greater uMngeni Catchment, South Africa

description: The project enhances water use efficiency by establishing and operationalising a national water reuse programme (WRP) that helps address the water scarcity issue by transforming the country’s wastewater system.
link_text: Climate Change Resilience through South Africa’s Water Reuse Programme (“WRP”)

description: South Africa’s Climate Smart Agriculture Strategic Framework define CSA as an approach that will assist the country in addressing the socio-economic challenges associated with the increasing change in climate. In our view, CSA addresses three key elements: - 1) Adaptation (by enhancing resilience of people, food, and agricultural production systems 2) Mitigation (minimising agricultural greenhouse emissions 3) Safeguarding food security in line with Sustainable Development Goals (SDG).
link_text: Climate Smart Agriculture Strategic Framework

description: A cross-cutting national policy with the overarching objective to communicate to the international community priority activities that will address South Sudan's urgent and immediate needs for adapting to the adverse impacts of climate change. South Sudan's NAPA specifies 5 priority activities (referred to as Priority Adaptation Projects), namely: i) Environment; ii) Water Resources; iii) Agriculture; iv) Disaster Risk Reduction; and v) Policy and Institutional Framework.
link_text: Republic of South Sudan's National Adaptation Programme of Actions (NAPA) to Climate Change

description: A project putting in place three components to address current and future impacts of climate change in South Sudan: (1) a multi-hazard early warning system, (2) a practical ecosystem-based adaptation process for people in flood affected areas, and (3) setting up a Climate Change Centre at the University of Juba.
link_text: Strengthening the Capacity of Government and Communities in South Sudan to Adapt to Climate Change

description: A four-year project designed to increase the resilience of vulnerable communities to the observed and predicted impacts of climate change. This project operationalizes the priorities identified within South Sudan’s National Adaptation Plan (NAP), particularly on agriculture, disaster risk reduction, environment, water resources, policy and institutional frameworks and will implement interventions designed to increase the capacity of the government to drive climate change adaptation interventions; upgrade the national meteorological network and support the production of short-range forecasts and increase the provision of ecosystem goods and services.
link_text: Ministry of Environment and Forestry, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) joint Memorandum of Understanding

description: A project with the aim of increasing the resilience of smallholder farmers and pastoralists to climate change risks mainly those related to drought, through the establishment of appropriate early warning systems and implementation of drought adaptation actions in the IGAD region.
link_text: Strengthening Drought Resilience for Small Holder Farmers and Pastoralists in the IGAD Region

description: A project with the objective to increase the adoption of sustainable land and water management practices in targeted landscapes
link_text: Sudan Sustainable Natural Resources Management Project (SSNRMP)

description: A project with the overall aim of increasing the resilience of livelihoods and agricultural systems in the White Nile State through ecosystem-based approaches such as rangeland regeneration, afforestation, rainwater harvesting and drought-tolerant agriculture.
link_text: Enhancing the resilience of communities living in climate change vulnerable areas of Sudan using EbA approaches

description: The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.
link_text: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin

description: The objective of proposed SWAHAT project is enhancing resilience and adaptation of semi arid rural communities to climate change-induced impacts of drought, floods and water scarcity through strategic water harvesting technologies that will contribute to improved crops, aquaculture and livestock productivity, reforestation as well as combating emerging crops and livestock pests and diseases.
link_text: Strategic Water Harvesting Technologies for Enhancing Resilience to Climate Change in Rural Communities in Semi-Arid Areas of Tanzania (SWAHAT)

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance in Tanzania

description: A regional project aiming to reduce the vulnerability of farmers and pastoralists to increase climatic risk, which undermines the level of food security, income generation, and the supporting ecosystem services of poor communities.
link_text: Promoting Climate-Smart Agriculture in West Africa

description: Regional project with coordinated and joint measures to improve climate adaptation, primarily concerned with integrated water management, and flood and drought early warning systems.
link_text: Integrating Flood and Drought Management and Early Warning for Climate Change Adaptation in the Volta Basin

description: A regional project proposing the Climate-Resilient Rice Production (CRRP) approach which addresses several challenges simultaneously while promoting adaptation to climate threats.
link_text: Scaling-up climate-resilient rice production in West Africa

description: An initiative with the goal of developing and implementing adaptation strategies and measures that will strengthen the resilience of vulnerable smallholder farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralists in the Horn of Africa to climate variability and change.
link_text: Agricultural Climate Resilience Enhancement Initiative (ACREI)

description: A project with the aim of increasing the resilience of smallholder farmers and pastoralists to climate change risks mainly those related to drought, through the establishment of appropriate early warning systems and implementation of drought adaptation actions in the IGAD region.
link_text: Strengthening Drought Resilience for Small Holder Farmers and Pastoralists in the IGAD Region

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance in Uganda

description: A programme promoting agricultural diversification, sustainability, and jobs to help Zambia achieve its potential as an agricultural powerhouse for Africa in the face of climate change.
link_text: Zambia Growth Opportunity Performance for Results Program (ZAMGRO)

description: A project to increase the climate resilience of smallholder farmers in agro-ecological regions through a value-chain approach to achieve increased access to climate information services, support for climate-resilient agricultural inputs and practices, sustainable water management, and alternative livelihoods.
link_text: Strengthening Climate Resilience of Agricultural Livelihoods in Agro-ecological Regions I and II (SCRALA)

description: A range of multi-sectoral national engagements and collaborations that support the development of national Climate-Smart Agriculture plans and their scaling-up
link_text: Africa Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) Alliance in Zambia

description: A project aiming to increase local communities’ adaptive capacity and resilience to climate change through sustainable groundwater utilisation for food security and other productive uses in rural areas of Zimbabwe.
link_text: Strengthening Local Communities’ Adaptive Capacity and Resilience to Climate Change through Sustainable Groundwater Utilisation in Zimbabwe

description: A report with the overall objective to influence the adoption of agroecology as a viable adaptation and mitigation solution to climate change through a coordinated national campaign programme.
link_text: Zimbabwe National Climate Policy Report: A Scoping Study for a National Campaign on Agroecology for Climate Action

description: Zimbabwe’s Low Emissions Development Strategy (2020-50) presents emissions reduction options across the four Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) reporting sectors namely the Energy Sector, Industrial Processes and Product Use (IPPU), Waste Sector and the broad Agriculture, Forestry and other Land Uses (AFOLU), covering the whole economy
link_text: Zimbabwe Long-term Low Greenhouse Gas Emission Development Strategy
